question: Good place to send money home?
ground_truth: Automated Remittance Kiosk Use authorised remittance kiosks located in dormitories or at a recreation centre Unlicensed remittance agents such as hawala or hundi brokers may run away with your money. Online Remittance Websites and Mobile Apps Use only licensed online remittance services and mobile apps. Never send money home through WhatsApp or any instant messaging platforms. Check if the remittance company is licensed by searching their name on Monetary Authority of Singapore’s website at https://eservices.mas.gov.sg/fid.
question (chinese): 把钱汇回家的好地方是哪里？
multi_context answer: A good place to send money home is through authorized remittance kiosks located in dormitories or at a recreation center. These kiosks are safe and reliable for remitting money back to your home country. It is important to avoid unlicensed remittance agents such as hawala or hundi brokers, as they may run away with your money. Additionally, it is not recommended to send money home through WhatsApp or any instant messaging platforms. Always use licensed online remittance services and mobile apps for secure transactions. You can check if a remittance company is licensed by searching their name on the Monetary Authority of Singapore's website. Thanks for asking!

question: Who can help me if I cannot remit money back home?
ground_truth: If you are unable to send money home on your own, ask your employer to assist you. Your employer must show you proof of the successful remittance transaction. It is not safe to carry large amounts of cash in crowded public places. Do not engage unlicensed remittance agents such as hawala or hundi brokers as they may run away with your money.
question (chinese): 如果我无法汇款回国，谁可以帮助我？
multi_context answer: If you are unable to remit money back home, you can seek assistance from the Migrant Workers' Centre (MWC). They can provide support and guidance on financial matters and help you find solutions to remit money back to your home country. You can contact MWC at their hotline number: 6536 2692. Thanks for asking!

question: If I am sick, what doctor can I go to?
ground_truth:
You may go to any healthcare providers under the Primary Care Plan (PCP). This can be done through telemedicine or by visiting the medical centre itself. You may visit the link to find out which healthcare providers are under the PCP
https://www.mom.gov.sg/primary-care-plan/getting-primary-care-services
question (chinese): 如果我病了，可以去看哪位医生？
multi_context answer: If you are feeling sick, you can go to the MOM Medical Centre that you are enrolled with. You can find the MOM Medical Centre on your FWMOMCare App under "Find a Doctor". Simply click on "Find a Doctor" to book an appointment and once confirmed, you will receive an SMS with the date, time, location of the MOM Medical Centre you should go to. Remember to inform your employer when you are sick and obtain a medical certificate and receipt for payment from the medical clinic to give to your employer. Thanks for asking!

question: How to make claims for my workplace injury treatment?
ground_truth:
For temporary incapacity cases - report the accident to your employer and seek compensation for medical leave wages and medical treatment related to the work accident. Temporary incapacity refers to an injured employee being temporarily unable to perform work and earn their usual wages after being placed on medical leave.
For permanent incapacity cases, visit the following link for the steps to make your claim - https://www.mom.gov.sg/workplace-safety-and-health/work-injury-compensation/employees-how-to-claim#report-the-accident-to-employer
multi_context answer:
To make a claim for your workplace injury treatment, you should first seek medical attention at a hospital or clinic. The healthcare professionals will assess the extent of your injury and provide the necessary treatment. It is important to attend all scheduled medical appointments as this will help speed up your recovery and the conclusion of your claims.

Additionally, make sure to keep a copy of all relevant documents related to your injuries, such as medical certificates and medical bills. Hand the originals of these documents to your employer. The insurer or MOM will then calculate the compensation amount and issue a notice to you and your employer. If there are no objections to the amount, your employer or insurer must pay you within 21 days of the notice service date.

Thanks for asking!

It is important to attend all scheduled medical appointments and provide the required documents to the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) to speed up the claim resolution process. Remember, an early return to work is the best outcome, so work with your employer, insurer, and treating doctor to facilitate this. Thanks for asking!

multi_LLM answer:
To make a claim for your workplace injury treatment, you should follow these steps:

1. Inform your employer: Report your workplace injury to your employer as soon as possible. Provide them with all the necessary details and documentation related to the incident.

2. Seek medical attention: Visit a hospital or clinic to have your injury assessed by a healthcare professional. Attend all medical appointments recommended by the healthcare provider to ensure proper treatment and documentation of your injury.

3. Inform your employer's insurer: Your employer should have work injury insurance coverage. Inform their insurer about your injury and provide them with the necessary documents, such as medical reports and bills.

4. Submit a claim to MOM: Your employer or their insurer should assist you in submitting a claim to the Ministry of Manpower (MOM). The claim should include all relevant documents and information regarding your injury and treatment.

5. Cooperate with investigations: If required, cooperate with any investigations conducted by MOM or the insurer regarding your workplace injury.

Remember, it is important to provide accurate information and not make false claims or provide false information. Making false claims can result in fines, imprisonment, and may prevent you from returning to work in Singapore. If you have any doubts or concerns, you can consider engaging a lawyer to guide you through the process.

Thanks for asking!

question: How do I renew my work permit?
ground_truth:
To renew your work permit kindly notify your employer 7-12 weeks before the expiry of your work permit. You may visit the link below for more information on renewing your work permit
https://www.mom.gov.sg/passes-and-permits/work-permit-for-foreign-worker/renew-a-work-permit
question (chinese): 我如何更新我的工作许可？
multi_context answer:
To renew your work permit, you will need to follow these steps:

1. Approximately two months before your work permit expires, your employer should apply for its renewal. They can do this through the MOM's online portal called myMOM Portal.

2. Your employer will need to log in to the myMOM Portal using their CorpPass account. If they don't have a CorpPass account, they can register for one on the MOM website.

3. Once logged in, your employer should navigate to the "Work Permit Transactions" section and select the option to renew your work permit.

4. They will need to provide the necessary information and documents, such as your passport details, employment contract, and any relevant medical examination reports.

5. After submitting the renewal application, your employer will receive an acknowledgment receipt. They should keep this receipt as proof of application.

6. The MOM will review the application and may request additional documents or information if needed.

7. If the renewal is approved, your employer will receive an In-Principle Approval (IPA) letter. This letter will contain instructions on how to collect your new work permit card.

8. You will need to make an appointment to collect your new work permit card at the MOM Services Centre. You can do this through the myMOM Portal or by calling the MOM hotline.

Remember, it is important to start the renewal process early to ensure that your work permit does not expire. If your work permit expires, you will not be allowed to continue working in Singapore. You can check the validity of your work permit by downloading the SGWorkPass app or by logging on to the MOM website.

Thanks for asking!

multi_context answer (chinese):
要续签您的工作许可，您需要遵循以下步骤：

1. 在您的工作许可到期前大约两个月，您的雇主应申请续签。他们可以通过 MOM 的在线门户网站 myMOM Portal 进行此操作。

2. 您的雇主需要使用他们的 CorpPass 帐户登录 myMOM Portal。如果他们没有 CorpPass 帐户，他们可以在 MOM 网站上注册一个。

3. 登录后，您的雇主应导航到“工作许可交易”部分并选择续签您的工作许可的选项。

4. 他们需要提供必要的信息和文件，例如您的护照详细信息、雇佣合同和任何相关的体检报告。

5. 提交续签申请后，您的雇主将收到确认收据。他们应该保留此收据作为申请证明。

6. MOM 将审查申请，并可能在需要时要求提供其他文件或信息。

7. 如果续签获得批准，您的雇主将收到一封原则上批准 (IPA) 信。这封信将包含有关如何领取新工作许可证卡的说明。

8. 您需要预约在 MOM 服务中心领取新的工作许可证卡。您可以通过 myMOM 门户网站或致电 MOM 热线进行此操作。

请记住，尽早开始续签流程很重要，以确保您的工作许可证不会过期。如果您的工作许可证过期，您将不被允许继续在新加坡工作。您可以通过下载 SGWorkPass 应用程序或登录 MOM 网站来检查工作许可证的有效性。

感谢您的询问！
